Description: Flowering plants add color, beauty, and fragrance to gardens and indoor spaces. They produce vibrant blooms in a wide range of colors, shapes, and sizes, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Popular examples include roses, orchids, tulips, and lilies.

Foliage plants are valued for their lush greenery and attractive foliage. They come in various shapes, sizes, and textures, making them versatile additions to gardens, landscapes, and indoor spaces. Foliage plants, such as ferns, philodendrons, and palms, add visual interest and texture to any setting.

Succulents and cacti are low-maintenance plants known for their unique forms and water-storing abilities. They come in a wide variety of shapes, sizes, and colors, ranging from tiny rosettes to towering columns. Succulents and cacti, such as aloe vera, echeveria, and prickly pear, thrive in arid environments and make excellent additions to drought-tolerant gardens and indoor displays.

Herbs are aromatic plants prized for their culinary, medicinal, and aromatic qualities. They add flavor, fragrance, and visual appeal to dishes, teas, and homemade remedies. Herbs, such as basil, rosemary, and mint, are easy to grow and can be cultivated in gardens, containers, or windowsills.

Flowering shrubs are versatile plants valued for their colorful blooms and landscape versatility. They come in various sizes and shapes, ranging from compact bushes to tall hedges, and can be used as focal points, borders, or privacy screens. Flowering shrubs, such as hydrangeas, azaleas, and lilacs, provide seasonal interest and attract pollinators to the garden.

Perennials are herbaceous plants that live for more than two years, returning year after year. They come in a wide range of sizes, colors, and bloom times, providing continuous interest throughout the growing season. Perennials, such as hostas, black-eyed susans, and coneflowers, are valued for their reliability, longevity, and ability to naturalize and spread in the garden.

Vegetables and fruits are edible plants grown for human consumption. They come in a variety of shapes, sizes, and flavors, offering a diverse array of culinary possibilities. Vegetables and fruits, such as tomatoes, strawberries, and blueberries, are rich in nutrients, antioxidants, and vitamins, making them essential components of a healthy diet.

Bonsai plants are miniature trees cultivated in shallow containers, trained to mimic the shape and scale of full-sized trees in nature. They require careful pruning, wiring, and maintenance to achieve their desired form and aesthetic appeal. Bonsai plants, such as ficus, juniper, and maple, are prized for their artistic beauty and symbolism in traditional Japanese culture.
